Header: Presidential Commission’s interim report on missing persons to be presented
Content: The Interim Report by the Presidential Commission to Inquire into Complaints of Missing Persons is due to be presented to the government on July 15. Chairman of the Commission Maxwell Paranagama said that the interim report will be handed over to the President on July 15. He added that an office to inquire into complaints of missing persons will be set up in the future. Maxwell Paranagama also said that about 6000 more complaints on missing persons are yet to be looked into.
